Posts.Content: I just had a mammogram a few weeks ago, and they found a lump in my left breast, I had a biopsy and it was fine. But I was scared out of my mind while I waited for the results. Hopefully yours will be fine also.
Posts.Title: mammogram question

Posts.Content: You can go where you had your mammogram done and request a copy of the report. Your doctor should have called you by now.
Posts.Title: Ignored Lump

Posts.Content: Thanks for the advise. I had my needle biopsy done Friday, so I should know something by Wednesday. I was scared out of my mind, but it wasn't as bad as I expected.
Posts.Title: Solid lump

Posts.Content: Hi, I am going through just about the same thing, I had a mammogram last Friday, and Tuesday the doctor's office called and wanted me to go back for a spot check and ultrasound, I had that done yesterday, and they found a solid lump. I am waiting for them to get me in to see a surgeon, I am thinking about having the entire lump removed instead of just a needle biopsy. I just don't think I would trust the needle biopsy. I have had lesions found in my colon, and in my chest, but they don't want to do a biopsy on them yet.
Posts.Title: Solid lump

Posts.Content: Lumps don't always mean cancer, it could just be a normal change. But go ahead and have the mammogram, if it is anything to be concerned about the earlier you get treatment, the better. I have had mammograms since I was 40, and last week was the first time that they found anything, a small solid lump, which I will be having a biopsy for soon. I just had my GYN exam a week before and the doctor didn't feel anything, so do go ahead and get your mammogram. Best of luck to you I am now 58 years old.
Posts.Title: Ignored Lump

Posts.Content: If I were you, I would find another doctor. A lot can happen between age 28 and 40. I am 58 and have had mammograms for the last 18 years faithfully, and just last week they found a lump in my left breast that the exam didn't find. In a weeks time, I had a mammogram, a spot mammogram, ultrasound, doctor visit, surgeon visit, and a needle biopsy. So don't let them put you off.
Posts.Title: fibrocystic breasts/lumpy breasts/ultrasound

Posts.Content: Call and make an appointment with your pcp. Tell them that you have a lump in your breast that is painful, that should get you in quicker. They will probably send you for a mammogram, or most likely a ultrasound. Good luck, and keep us posted.
Posts.Title: Found a lump.. only 22

Posts.Content: It could possibly be lymph nodes, they do swell from time to time from infection. Consult with your doctor.
Posts.Title: Lump under armpit
